summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel B) of the City of Dallas will convene on January 17, 2024, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning and regulatory requests, including special exceptions and variances.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing for testimony, and approval of previous meeting minutes. The Board will review both uncontested and individual case items, focusing on requests for exceptions to zoning regulations.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include applications for special exceptions related to front-yard setbacks, landscaping regulations, parking regulations, and fence height and opacity standards. Additionally, there is a holdover case concerning a variance to side-yard setbacks. Individual cases will involve appeals regarding administrative decisions on building permits.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the December 13, 2023 meeting and will deliberate on the listed zoning requests. Decisions will be made on whether to grant the various applications presented during the public hearing. Interested parties must register to speak by January 16, 2024, to participate in the discussions.
